channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @Ah_Pook_Is_Here @YourVote2022 @TristanSnell Right. It’s not his call whether to indict — but it would be irresponsible at this point for Garland not to give him (and the FBI) a heads-up.
item.source:markdown: @Ah_Pook_Is_Here @YourVote2022 @TristanSnell Right. It’s not his call whether to indict — but it would be irresponsible at this point for Garland not to give him (and the FBI) a heads-up.

item.description:
@WinterlightHome I hear it.

@WinterlightHome The parts of shul-going I like the best involve the individual — davening, leyning, Torah study, social justice work.
item.source:markdown:
@WinterlightHome I hear it.
@WinterlightHome The parts of shul-going I like the best involve the individual — davening, leyning, Torah study, social justice work.

item.description: @6502_ftw People want to believe. That’s what makes shamelessness such a superpower.
item.source:markdown: @6502_ftw People want to believe. That’s what makes shamelessness such a superpower.

item.description:
@WinterlightHome Books! Texts! Poems!

@WinterlightHome So much much of that family focus comes down to people seeing Judaism as kid stuff that only matters for the next generation of kids.

@WinterlightHome It creates synagogues that serve the bar mitzvah, rather than b mitzvahs that serve the synagogue.
@onthemainline @JewYid @BenNiderberg Hmmm. The Koren Koran. Adding to my Purim 2do list....
item.source:markdown: @onthemainline @JewYid @BenNiderberg Hmmm. The Koren Koran. Adding to my Purim 2do list....

item.description: Trump’s uncle the nuclear scientist would no be proud of this accomplishment, made possible by the former president. https://t.co/dAeVECgVza

item.description: @joshtpm @TPM Seems like something the OMB would have been responsible for preventing, no? Seems like someone might want to speak to Mick… https://t.co/a6ahdWyKuw

item.description:
@trekonomics It’s a classic. By which I mean it was genuinely mind blowing two generations ago.

@trekonomics I ploughed through it the summer I turned 13. I wasn’t that impressed; perhaps it was over my head.

@trekonomics But I doubt it was worse than Ivanhoe, which my English teacher tried to convince me has merit a couple years later.
Remember the Benghazi hearings. Never retreat. Never surrender. https://t.co/hOeju0MAHd
item.source:markdown: Remember the Benghazi hearings. Never retreat. Never surrender. https://t.co/hOeju0MAHd

item.description: @trekonomics You keep knocking American “cheese,” but what other food product has two continents and an isthmus named after it?
item.source:markdown: @trekonomics You keep knocking American “cheese,” but what other food product has two continents and an isthmus named after it?

item.description:
Your occasional reminder that a North Jersey teen went to NH to campaign for Ron Paul in 2011 and came back radicalized and started attacking synagogues. https://t.co/dY89x25TR3

It didn’t end well for him. https://t.co/6UA6wTwBFp

Nobody seems to have investigated who led him to throw his life away, but it seems like the quoted twitter account is a strong clue.
item.source:markdown:
Your occasional reminder that a North Jersey teen went to NH to campaign for Ron Paul in 2011 and came back radicalized and started attacking synagogues. https://t.co/dY89x25TR3
It didn’t end well for him. https://t.co/6UA6wTwBFp
Nobody seems to have investigated who led him to throw his life away, but it seems like the quoted twitter account is a strong clue.

item.description: @trekonomics I suspect these two weeks will play a disproportionate role in the trailer for the Hollywood film adaptation.

item.description: @5DollarFeminist Shouldn’t there be a claim that allegedly improperly seized materials were (1) outside the scope of the warrant for specific reasons and (2) their seizure and review by the government constitute harm that requires immediate relief?
item.source:markdown: @5DollarFeminist Shouldn’t there be a claim that allegedly improperly seized materials were (1) outside the scope of the warrant for specific reasons and (2) their seizure and review by the government constitute harm that requires immediate relief?

item.description:
@hilzoy @TPM Maybe. But isn’t there a central govt agency in charge of processes? Maybe OMB? Were there centralized policies in place during the Obama administration or was it a free-for-all then too?

@hilzoy @TPM I mean, it’s not like Mick Mulvaney would have opposed government data retention when he headed OMB, right, given his reputation as an advocate of transparency and honesty?
item.source:markdown:
@hilzoy @TPM Maybe. But isn’t there a central govt agency in charge of processes? Maybe OMB? Were there centralized policies in place during the Obama administration or was it a free-for-all then too?
@hilzoy @TPM I mean, it’s not like Mick Mulvaney would have opposed government data retention when he headed OMB, right, given his reputation as an advocate of transparency and honesty?

item.description: @protecttruth_ @ElieNYC Judicial Watch no doubt believes that Separation of Powers bars Congress from regulating the President. The question ultimately is whether Alito agrees.
item.source:markdown: @protecttruth_ @ElieNYC Judicial Watch no doubt believes that Separation of Powers bars Congress from regulating the President. The question ultimately is whether Alito agrees.
